subject: IMF GLOBAL DEBT SETTLEMENT CO
body:
IMF GLOBAL DEBT SETTLEMENT COMMITTEE
1900 Pennsylvania Ave NW,
Washington, DC 20431, USA
Our Ref: IMF/PYMS/INTER-18-23
UNO/WBF LM-05-371/LM-05-371
FOR YOUR URGENT ATTENTION,
The IMF Global Debt Settlement Committee in conjunction with the World Bank has received your pending payment, with an international payment voucher number (LM-87-9897). Your name was shortlisted among others whose international payment has long been overdue for settlement.
With reference number UNO/WBF LM-87-9897, your pending payment has been scheduled for immediate release via our committees authorized corresponding bank . The IMF was alarmed by her recent findings on global banking inside practices, perpetuated and instigated by unauthorized banking practice. This unprofessional activity in some banks has resulted in international wire delays, permanent freezing of funds and seizures.  In order to resolve the crisis, the IMF in conjunction with various foreign Governments and financial agencies has audited and authorized release and payment of 291 frozen assets and funds to victims.
Due to the corrupt and inefficient Banking Systems in some countries involved, the Payments are to be supervised by the 'IMF' Officials through their corresponding Banks. According to the number of applicants at hand, half of the victims are from the United States. You are hereby warned not to communicate or duplicate this message to any ongoing communication between you and any individual or bank in connection with your loss for any reason whatsoever, this is to avoid conflict with ongoing criminal investigation.  You are advised to reconfirm to this committee the following details, to enable us to confirm your identity and issue an irrevocable payment order to our authorized paying bank.
Your full name
Company's name
Registered Address
Prove of identification
Telephone
We shall communicate you with further modalities as soon as we hear from you.
Sincerely,
Mr. Derek L.Bills.
Chairman
IMF Global Debt Committee
Ph: +1-202-869-0339

subject: Re:  IMF GLOBAL DEBT SETTLEMENT CO
body:
Hello Mr. Derek,

Thank you for reaching out and providing such detailed information about the IMF Global Debt Settlement Committee's activities. It's fascinating to learn about the steps being taken to resolve global banking issues.

I'm curious, could you please elaborate more on how this process works? How does the committee identify victims of these banking practices? 

Also, I'd love to know more about the role of the World Bank in this initiative. Are they directly involved in the payment release process or do they play a more supervisory role?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Dennis

subject: Re: IMF GLOBAL DEBT SETTLEMENT COMMITTEE
body:
Hello,

We acknowledge receipt of your email concerning my notification message and
appreciate your interest in further information regarding our committee's
mandate.

With reference to our initial correspondence, we currently have over a
thousand individuals who have fallen victim to these malpractices. While
over 200 individuals have been identified and shortlisted for payment. The
IMF has an agency dedicated to investigating these cases, identifying
victims, and referring them to our committee for processing.

As mentioned previously, this initiative involves collaboration between our
two agencies, the World Bank and IMF in the investigation and approval of
victims for payment. However, payments are facilitated through our
commercial corresponding institutions. We will diligently monitor the
process until you confirm receipt of payment.

The first step is providing the details requested in our previous email,
these details will enable us to conduct verification through your file.
Upon satisfactory vetting, your file will be forwarded to our commercial
corresponding bank for immediate payment.

We look forward to your urgent response.
Regards,

Mr. Derek L. Bills.

Chairman,

IMF Global Debt Committee

Ph: +1-202-869-0339
